items.title: New video of U.S. seizing oil tanker off coast of Venezuela
items.standfirst: President Trump announced Wednesday that the U.S. has seized an oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela. Attorney General Pam Bondi released video, which shows U.S. law enforcement and military executing a seizure warrant. CBS News White House reporter Olivia Rinaldi has more.
items.content: President Trump announced Wednesday that the U.S. has seized an oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela. Attorney General Pam Bondi released video, which shows U.S. law enforcement and military executing a seizure warrant. CBS News White House reporter Olivia Rinaldi has more.

items.title: U.S. Seizes Oil Tanker Off Venezuela in Escalation of Pressure on Maduro Regime

items.content: The move comes amid heightened tension between Washington and Caracas, and hours after the country’s opposition leader left the country on a boat.

items.title: US forces seize oil tanker off Venezuela coast
items.standfirst: Move is major escalation of US pressure campaign against South American country’s dictator, Nicolás MaduroUS politics live – latest updatesUS forces have seized an oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela, in a major escalation of Donald Trump’s four-month pressure campaign against the South American country’s dictator, Nicolás Maduro.The US president confirmed the operation on Wednesday. “We’ve just seized a tanker on the coast of Venezuela – a large tanker, very large, the largest one ever seized actually,” he said. “And other things are happening so you will be seeing that later and you will be talking about that later with other people.” Continue reading...

items.title: US forces seize oil tanker off coast of Venezuela, Trump says
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump said Wednesday that US forces seized a large oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela, marking his administration's latest escalation in its pressure campaign against President Nicolas Maduro. The embattled Venezuelan leader demanded an end to Washington's "illegal" intervention in his country, months into a naval deployment that has sparked fears of military action.
items.content: President Donald Trump said Wednesday that US forces seized a large oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela, marking his administration's latest escalation in its pressure campaign against President Nicolas Maduro. The embattled Venezuelan leader demanded an end to Washington's "illegal" intervention in his country, months into a naval deployment that has sparked fears of military action.

items.title: U.S. seizes oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela, Trump says

items.standfirst: The Federal Reserve, the central bank of the United States, voted to lower its federal funds rate—the interest rate that banks charge each other to borrow overnight and the cost of credit—by 25 basis points on Wednesday. This is the Fed's third rate cut in as many months and the lowest federal…

items.title: US Federal Reserve cuts interest rates for the third straight time
items.standfirst: The US Federal Reserve has lowered its benchmark rate by a quarter percentage point, to a range of 3.5% - 3.75%, but signalled there will be fewer cuts going forward amid a cooling labour market and persistently high inflation. The vote was not unanimous, with two calling for keeping rates unchanged, and Trump ally Stephen Miran wanting a larger cut. Also in the segment, the United Arab Emirates is turning towards AI as part of a strategy at ensuring its future in a post-fossil-fuels world.
items.content: The US Federal Reserve has lowered its benchmark rate by a quarter percentage point, to a range of 3.5% - 3.75%, but signalled there will be fewer cuts going forward amid a cooling labour market and persistently high inflation. The vote was not unanimous, with two calling for keeping rates unchanged, and Trump ally Stephen Miran wanting a larger cut. Also in the segment, the United Arab Emirates is turning towards AI as part of a strategy at ensuring its future in a post-fossil-fuels world.

items.title: Fed cuts interest rates by a quarter point amid apparent split over US economy
items.standfirst: Divisive vote to lower rates highlights uncertainty in the Fed as economy absorbs major shakeups, including tariffsThe US Federal Reserve announced on Wednesday that it was cutting interest rates by a quarter point for the third time this year, as the embattled central bank appeared split over how best to manage the US economy.The Fed chair, Jerome Powell, has emphasized unity within the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC), the board of Fed leaders that sets interest rates. But the nine-to-three vote to lower rates to a range of 3.5% to 3.75% was divisive among the committee that tends to vote in unanimity. Continue reading...
items.content: Divisive vote to lower rates highlights uncertainty in the Fed as economy absorbs major shakeups, including tariffsThe US Federal Reserve announced on Wednesday that it was cutting interest rates by a quarter point for the third time this year, as the embattled central bank appeared split over how best to manage the US economy.The Fed chair, Jerome Powell, has emphasized unity within the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC), the board of Fed leaders that sets interest rates. But the nine-to-three vote to lower rates to a range of 3.5% to 3.75% was divisive among the committee that tends to vote in unanimity. Continue reading...

items.title: Machado to come out of hiding after missing Nobel ceremony
items.standfirst: Nobel laureate Maria Corina Machado is set to address the world on Thursday, according to the Norwegian government, after the Venezuelan opposition leader was awarded the prestigious peace prize in her absence. FRANCE 24's Sharon Gaffney speaks with Phil Gunson, Senior Analyst at International Crisis Group.

items.standfirst: Right-wing opposition leader Maria Corina Machado missed the ceremony awarding her this year’s Nobel Peace Prize.
items.content: Right-wing opposition leader Maria Corina Machado missed the ceremony awarding her this year’s Nobel Peace Prize.

items.title: She missed the ceremony, but Peace Prize winner is heading to Oslo
items.standfirst: The Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado didn't make it to Oslo in time to receive the Nobel Peace Prize in person, in an extraordinary day shrouded in uncertainty over her whereabouts.
items.content: The Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado didn't make it to Oslo in time to receive the Nobel Peace Prize in person, in an extraordinary day shrouded in uncertainty over her whereabouts.

items.title: Venezuelan Nobel peace prize winner misses ceremony but vows to continue struggle
items.standfirst: Daughter delivers speech, with Nobel Institute saying María Corina Machado still expected in Oslo after journey of ‘extreme danger’Venezuela’s most prominent opposition leader, María Corina Machado, has vowed to continue her struggle to free the country from years of “obscene corruption”, “brutal dictatorship” and “despair” as she was awarded the Nobel peace prize at a ceremony in Norway’s capital, Oslo.The 58-year-old conservative has lived in hiding in Venezuela since its authoritarian leader, Nicolás Maduro, was accused of stealing the 2024 presidential election from her political movement. Despite fevered speculation that she would make a dramatic appearance at Wednesday’s event, having somehow slipped out of Venezuela, Machado was not present, although she was expected to arrive in Oslo in the coming hours. Continue reading...
items.content: Daughter delivers speech, with Nobel Institute saying María Corina Machado still expected in Oslo after journey of ‘extreme danger’Venezuela’s most prominent opposition leader, María Corina Machado, has vowed to continue her struggle to free the country from years of “obscene corruption”, “brutal dictatorship” and “despair” as she was awarded the Nobel peace prize at a ceremony in Norway’s capital, Oslo.The 58-year-old conservative has lived in hiding in Venezuela since its authoritarian leader, Nicolás Maduro, was accused of stealing the 2024 presidential election from her political movement. Despite fevered speculation that she would make a dramatic appearance at Wednesday’s event, having somehow slipped out of Venezuela, Machado was not present, although she was expected to arrive in Oslo in the coming hours. Continue reading...

items.title: Nobel Peace Prize winner's daughter accepts award on her behalf

items.content: Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado, who lives in hiding, is reportedly on her way to Oslo.

items.title: Venezuela's opposition leader's daughter collects the Nobel Peace Prize on her behalf
items.standfirst: María Corina Machado, the Venezuelan opposition leader who was awarded this year’s Nobel Peace Prize, did not attend the ceremony in Oslo, Norway. Machado's daughter, Ana Corina Sosa Machado, collected the Nobel Peace Prize on her mother's behalf and read a speech prepared by Maria Corina Machado. NBC News' Molly Hunter reports on the controversy surrounding Machado's win, linked to Machado's support for U.S. military actions against purported drug boats.
items.content: María Corina Machado, the Venezuelan opposition leader who was awarded this year’s Nobel Peace Prize, did not attend the ceremony in Oslo, Norway. Machado's daughter, Ana Corina Sosa Machado, collected the Nobel Peace Prize on her mother's behalf and read a speech prepared by Maria Corina Machado. NBC News' Molly Hunter reports on the controversy surrounding Machado's win, linked to Machado's support for U.S. military actions against purported drug boats.

items.title: US plans to order foreign tourists to disclose social media histories

items.title: ‘Coalition of the willing’ nations to hold call on ending war in Ukraine
items.standfirst: Keir Starmer, Emmanuel Macron and others to discuss peace plan as US tries to push through peace dealLeaders of the “coalition of the willing” group of nations will hold a video call on Thursday as chaotic American efforts to push through a peace deal to end the war in Ukraine reach a crunch moment.Ukraine’s president, Volodymyr Zelenskyy, said his officials would hand over a revised version of a peace plan to US negotiators on Wednesday before the call with leaders and officials from about 30 countries. Continue reading...
items.content: Keir Starmer, Emmanuel Macron and others to discuss peace plan as US tries to push through peace dealLeaders of the “coalition of the willing” group of nations will hold a video call on Thursday as chaotic American efforts to push through a peace deal to end the war in Ukraine reach a crunch moment.Ukraine’s president, Volodymyr Zelenskyy, said his officials would hand over a revised version of a peace plan to US negotiators on Wednesday before the call with leaders and officials from about 30 countries. Continue reading...

items.title: ‘He served with honour’: Starmer pays tribute to British soldier killed in Ukraine
items.standfirst: L/Cpl George Hooley, 28, reportedly died in accident away from frontline while observing test with Ukrainian soldiersThe British soldier who died in Ukraine on Tuesday has been named as L/Cpl George Hooley, 28, of the Parachute regiment.Keir Starmer told the Commons on Wednesday that Hooley had died in a “tragic accident” away from the frontlines while watching a test of “a new defensive capability” with members of the Ukrainian military. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy met with Pope Leo XIV in Rome on Tuesday, as Kyiv said it was preparing to send “refined” proposals to the United States for ending the war with Russia.

items.content: Iceland joins Spain, Ireland, Slovenia and the Netherlands in saying it will boycott the 2026 contest.

items.title: Iceland joins boycott of Eurovision 2026 in protest at Israel’s involvement
items.standfirst: Iceland joins four other nations in a boycott, after the organiser declined to hold a vote over Israel's involvement.
items.content: Iceland joins four other nations in a boycott, after the organiser declined to hold a vote over Israel's involvement.

items.title: Iceland joins boycott of 2026 Eurovision over Israel's participation
items.standfirst: Iceland will not take part in the 2026 Eurovision Song Contest in Austria, the country's public broadcaster said Wednesday, becoming the fifth country to boycott the competition after organisers declined to exclude Israel from participating over its conduct of the war in Gaza.
items.content: Iceland will not take part in the 2026 Eurovision Song Contest in Austria, the country's public broadcaster said Wednesday, becoming the fifth country to boycott the competition after organisers declined to exclude Israel from participating over its conduct of the war in Gaza.

items.title: Iceland becomes fifth country to boycott Eurovision after Israel allowed to take part
items.standfirst: Iceland has announced it is boycotting next year's Eurovision over Israel's participation in the competition, saying taking part would "neither be a source of joy nor peace".
items.content: Iceland has announced it is boycotting next year's Eurovision over Israel's participation in the competition, saying taking part would "neither be a source of joy nor peace".

clusters.title: Judge blocks Trump's National Guard deployment in LA with sharp rebuke
clusters.neutral_headline: US federal judge halts Trump’s National Guard operations in California

items.title: Judge blocks Trump's National Guard deployment in LA with sharp rebuke
items.standfirst: In the latest in a series of legal setbacks for Trump's deployments, a judge ruled the administration must end its deployment to Los Angeles and return control of National Guard troops to California.
items.content: In the latest in a series of legal setbacks for Trump's deployments, a judge ruled the administration must end its deployment to Los Angeles and return control of National Guard troops to California.(Image credit: Jim Vondruska)

items.title: US federal judge halts Trump’s National Guard operations in California
items.standfirst: California Governor Newsom celebrates court victory against Trump’s extended National Guard presence in Los Angeles.
items.content: California Governor Newsom celebrates court victory against Trump’s extended National Guard presence in Los Angeles.

items.title: US judge blocks Trump's National Guard deployment in Los Angeles
items.standfirst: The judge has ordered control of the the troops, which were deployed in June, to be returned to California's governor.
items.content: The judge has ordered control of the the troops, which were deployed in June, to be returned to California's governor.

items.standfirst: Cisco was at the center of the internet boom, but has a much different role in today's artificial intelligence craze.
items.content: Cisco was at the center of the internet boom, but has a much different role in today's artificial intelligence craze.

items.title: Cisco Shares Finally Top Dot-Com Record After More Than 25 Years
items.standfirst: Cisco Systems Inc., a bellwether stock of the dot-com technological revolution, has returned to a record after a quarter century, thanks in part to the artificial intelligence spending boom.
items.content: Cisco Systems Inc., a bellwether stock of the dot-com technological revolution, has returned to a record after a quarter century, thanks in part to the artificial intelligence spending boom.

clusters.title: Rwanda-backed M23 militia storms DRC city, displacing 200,000
clusters.neutral_headline: Rwanda-backed M23 militia storms DRC city, displacing 200,000

items.title: Rwanda-backed M23 militia storms DRC city, displacing 200,000
items.standfirst: About 200,000 people have fled the Democratic Republic of the Congo after Rwanda-backed M23 rebels surged into Uvira.
items.content: About 200,000 people have fled the Democratic Republic of the Congo after Rwanda-backed M23 rebels surged into Uvira.

items.title: DRC fighting forces 200,000 to flee just days after Washington peace deal
items.standfirst: Rwanda-backed M23 rebels clash with Congolese army and other groups as they march on strategic eastern townAbout 200,000 people have fled their homes in the Democratic Republic of the Congo as Rwanda-backed rebels march on a strategic eastern town just days after Donald Trump hosted the Rwandan and Congolese leaders to proclaim peace.The UN said at least 74 people had been killed, mostly civilians, and 83 admitted to hospital with wounds from escalating clashes in the area in recent days. Continue reading...
items.content: Rwanda-backed M23 rebels clash with Congolese army and other groups as they march on strategic eastern townAbout 200,000 people have fled their homes in the Democratic Republic of the Congo as Rwanda-backed rebels march on a strategic eastern town just days after Donald Trump hosted the Rwandan and Congolese leaders to proclaim peace.The UN said at least 74 people had been killed, mostly civilians, and 83 admitted to hospital with wounds from escalating clashes in the area in recent days. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Toffee Crisp and Blue Riband no longer called ‘chocolate’ after recipe change
clusters.neutral_headline: Toffee Crisp and Blue Riband no longer called ‘chocolate’ after recipe change

items.title: Toffee Crisp and Blue Riband no longer called ‘chocolate’ after recipe change
items.standfirst: Nestlé confectionery treats now described as being ‘encased in a smooth milk chocolate flavour coating’Toffee Crisp and Blue Riband bars can no longer be called chocolate after Nestlé reformulated their recipes due to the increasing cost of ingredients.The Swiss conglomerate now describes the treats as being “encased in a smooth milk chocolate flavour coating”, rather than being covered in milk chocolate. Continue reading...
items.content: Nestlé confectionery treats now described as being ‘encased in a smooth milk chocolate flavour coating’Toffee Crisp and Blue Riband bars can no longer be called chocolate after Nestlé reformulated their recipes due to the increasing cost of ingredients.The Swiss conglomerate now describes the treats as being “encased in a smooth milk chocolate flavour coating”, rather than being covered in milk chocolate. Continue reading...

items.title: Toffee Crisp and Blue Riband can't be called chocolate any more
items.standfirst: Nestle has used more vegetable oil in it recipes, meaning the treats no longer qualify as chocolate under UK law
items.content: Nestle has used more vegetable oil in it recipes, meaning the treats no longer qualify as chocolate under UK law

clusters.title: Sarkozy releases prison diaries about his 20 days behind bars
clusters.neutral_headline: Sarkozy releases prison diaries about his 20 days behind bars

items.title: Sarkozy releases prison diaries about his 20 days behind bars
items.standfirst: The former French president was jailed for taking part in an election campaign funding conspiracy.
items.content: The former French president was jailed for taking part in an election campaign funding conspiracy.

items.title: 'Welcome to hell': Sarkozy discusses prison stay, far-right rapprochement in new book
items.standfirst: Former French president Nicolas Sarkozy describes his recent 20-day stint in prison as “hell” in a new book released on Wednesday. His “Diary of a Prisoner” provides a rare glimpse into La Santé prison in Paris, were Sarkozy was kept in solitary confinement for security reasons. It also sees the ex-president turn his back on the “republican front” of parties that has traditionally kept the far-right out of power.
items.content: Former French president Nicolas Sarkozy describes his recent 20-day stint in prison as “hell” in a new book released on Wednesday. His “Diary of a Prisoner” provides a rare glimpse into La Santé prison in Paris, were Sarkozy was kept in solitary confinement for security reasons. It also sees the ex-president turn his back on the “republican front” of parties that has traditionally kept the far-right out of power.

items.title: Sarkozy: French ex-president releases 20-day prison diary
items.standfirst: The former French president is releasing a book recounting the 20 days he spent in jail after being convicted in a case involving alleged Libyan financing of his 2007 campaign, a conviction he has appealed.
items.content: The former French president is releasing a book recounting the 20 days he spent in jail after being convicted in a case involving alleged Libyan financing of his 2007 campaign, a conviction he has appealed.

items.title: Ex-French president Sarkozy publishes jail memoirs, encourages far right outreach
items.standfirst: Former French President Nicolas Sarkozy has written a book in which he describes the prison where he spent 20 days, after being sentenced to jail time in connection with campaign-financing cases. He also offers advice on how his conservative party could appeal to far-right voters. FRANCE 24's Marc Perelman has the analysis.
items.content: Former French President Nicolas Sarkozy has written a book in which he describes the prison where he spent 20 days, after being sentenced to jail time in connection with campaign-financing cases. He also offers advice on how his conservative party could appeal to far-right voters. FRANCE 24's Marc Perelman has the analysis.

items.content: At least 22 people are dead and more than a dozen injured after a double building collapse in Morocco.

items.title: Author Sophie Kinsella, who penned the 'Shopaholic' books, has died at 55
items.standfirst: The author, whose real name was Madeleine Sophie Wickham, was diagnosed with an aggressive form of brain cancer in late 2022.
items.content: The author, whose real name was Madeleine Sophie Wickham, was diagnosed with an aggressive form of brain cancer in late 2022.(Image credit: Anthony Harvey)

clusters.title: Brazil: Lower house votes to slash ex-president Bolsonaro's sentence
clusters.neutral_headline: Chaos in Brazil Congress during push to cut Bolsonaro's sentence

items.title: Brazil: Lower house votes to slash ex-president Bolsonaro's sentence
items.standfirst: Brazil’s lower house of Congress approved a bill early Wednesday that could reduce the amount of time former that President Jair Bolsonaro spends in prison, where he currently is after being sentenced to more than 27 years behind bars for attempting a coup. FRANCE 24's Tim Vickery has the latest from Rio de Janeiro.
items.content: Brazil’s lower house of Congress approved a bill early Wednesday that could reduce the amount of time former that President Jair Bolsonaro spends in prison, where he currently is after being sentenced to more than 27 years behind bars for attempting a coup. FRANCE 24's Tim Vickery has the latest from Rio de Janeiro.

items.title: Chaos in Brazil Congress during push to cut Bolsonaro's sentence
items.standfirst: Scuffles broke out during a vote linked to attempts to reduce the former president's jail term.
items.content: Scuffles broke out during a vote linked to attempts to reduce the former president's jail term.

items.content: Donald Trump, who brokered an earlier ceasefire, says he plans to "make a phone call" to stop the fighting.

items.title: Fatal Thailand-Cambodia clashes spread along contested border area
items.standfirst: Each side has blamed the other for renewed clashes, which have derailed a ceasefire brokered by Donald TrumpDeadly clashes have escalated along the disputed Thailand-Cambodia border as both sides blamed each other for the fighting and vowed to defend their territories.Seven civilians have been killed and 20 wounded in Cambodia and three Thai soldiers have been killed in the fiercest fighting since a five-day conflict in July. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Surveillance video captures suspects with stolen paintings in Brazil
clusters.neutral_headline: CCTV shows suspects make off on foot with stolen artworks

items.title: Surveillance video captures suspects with stolen paintings in Brazil
items.standfirst: Surveillance video captured the moment eight artworks by the French artist Henri Matisse were stolen from a library in São Paulo, Brazil. Officials have made one arrest but are still looking for a second suspect.
items.content: Surveillance video captured the moment eight artworks by the French artist Henri Matisse were stolen from a library in São Paulo, Brazil. Officials have made one arrest but are still looking for a second suspect.

items.title: Suspect arrested in theft of 8 Matisse artworks from a library in Brazil
items.standfirst: Eight artworks by the French artist Henri Matisse were stolen from a library in São Paulo, Brazil, on Sunday, according to the museum that commissioned the exhibition
items.content: Eight artworks by the French artist Henri Matisse were stolen from a library in São Paulo, Brazil, on Sunday, according to the museum that commissioned the exhibition

items.title: CCTV shows suspects make off on foot with stolen artworks
items.standfirst: Brazilian officials say thieves held up a security guard and an elderly couple before making off with the artworks, including some by the famed French artist Henri Matisse.
items.content: Brazilian officials say thieves held up a security guard and an elderly couple before making off with the artworks, including some by the famed French artist Henri Matisse.
